wiki.summary: On “Sweetener,” the titular track to Ariana Grande’s fourth-studio album, Ari talks about bad situations in life and how you can bring light and a positive vibe to “sweeten” them. The track is very reminiscent of a 90s soul hip-hop song, but with elements of modern trap. The track was teased in her “ No Tears Left To Cry” music video, and was hinted again in the “ No Tears Left To Cry (BTS – Part 2)” video. This track was recorded and written back in July of 2016. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: On “Sweetener,” the titular track to Ariana Grande’s fourth-studio album, Ari talks about bad situations in life and how you can bring light and a positive vibe to “sweeten” them. The track is very reminiscent of a 90s soul hip-hop song, but with elements of modern trap. The track was teased in her “ No Tears Left To Cry” music video, and was hinted again in the “ No Tears Left To Cry (BTS – Part 2)” video. This track was recorded and written back in July of 2016. "It was the first song off the project to be completed." Ariana had also posted an Instagram story, showing a screenshot of her listening to the track. On July 21st, 2018, a paparazzi managed to record a snippet of the song while Ariana was listening to it in her car. She later confirmed it was indeed “Sweetener”. Read more on Last.fm.
